About

AisenLink

All about Tinkering and Hacking for The Connected Things

Guess what, you've come this far to this site, because you love to tinker and to hack things. Tinkering and hacking are unique ways to understand how things work and to alter features as you would. Things can be anything from everyday objects to sophisticated computer technologies around us. When things get connected, they are able to exchange information. They become smarter devices and aware of its surrounding. People call this intelligent as the Internet of Things (IoT). I simply call it - The Connected Things.

This website is hosted on Github Pages. The template was taken from Jekyll-Pure project by Xiongzhi Gao, with some improvements here and there. The posting tag's layout was taken from Twitter Bootstrap and those attractive icons are Font Awesome. The cartoon owl was designed by lemmling and bocian, freely available to download from OpenClipart. For comments posting, Disqus seems great, but I don't have it set just yet. So, if you have something to say, please feel free to email me or use Skype. I appreciate any comments or ideas to improve this website. Better yet, if you find this place useful, please consider donating any amount in USD/Euro by clicking the Paypal button below.

Thank you for visiting and supporting this site!
